title: 조동사와 관련 표현
description: 능력, 가능성, 의무, 허가를 표현하는 조동사와 관련 어휘를 배웁니다.

words.exampleMeaning: 나는 수영을 아주 잘 할 수 있다.

confusableWords.difference: Can은 현재, Could는 과거 또는 더 공손한 표현

words.example: I could run fast when I was young.
words.exampleMeaning: 어렸을 때 나는 빨리 달릴 수 있었다.
words.mnemonic: Could = Can의 과거 또는 공손한 표현

confusableWords.difference: Can은 현재 능력, Could는 과거 또는 공손함

additionalExamples.sentence: I would like a cup of tea.

confusableWords.difference: Must는 내부 의무, Have to는 외부 의무
May는 가능성 높음, Might는 가능성 낮음

words.example: I will be able to finish it tomorrow.
words.exampleMeaning: 나는 내일 그것을 끝낼 수 있을 것이다.
words.mnemonic: Be able to = Can과 같지만 모든 시제 가능

confusableWords.difference: Can은 현재만, Be able to는 모든 시제 가능

additionalExamples.sentence: He was able to solve the problem.
additionalExamples.meaning: 그는 그 문제를 풀 수 있었다.

words.example: I have to go to work early.

confusableWords.difference: Have to는 외부 의무, Must는 내부 의무

additionalExamples.sentence: Do you have to leave now?

words.example: She has the ability to learn quickly.

additionalExamples.sentence: He has great ability in math.

words.example: There is a possibility of rain.

additionalExamples.sentence: Is it necessary to bring it?

words.example: You have an obligation to help.
Let me give you some advice.
I have a request to make.
Taking photos is forbidden in the museum.
She is capable of doing great things.
words.exampleMeaning: 그녀는 위대한 일을 할 수 있는 능력이 있습니다.

words.example: Is it possible to change the date?

additionalExamples.meaning: 아마도 우리가 가야 할 것 같아요.

confusableWords.difference: Probably는 높은 확률, Maybe는 중간 확률

additionalExamples.sentence: Can you recommend a good book?
additionalExamples.meaning: 좋은 책 추천해 주실 수 있나요?

words.example: Can I offer you a drink?
You need a permit to park here.

additionalExamples.sentence: Do you have a work permit?

words.example: Don't force me to do it.
She encouraged me to try again.

words.mnemonic: Pre + vent = 미리 오지 못하게 = 방지하다

words.example: I am certain he will come.
She is confident about the test.
words.mnemonic: Con + fid(믿다) = 자신을 믿는 = 자신감 있는

confusableWords.difference: Likely는 ~할 것 같은, Unlikely는 ~할 것 같지 않은

words.example: This app enables you to learn English.
words.exampleMeaning: 이 앱은 영어를 배울 수 있게 해줍니다.

additionalExamples.meaning: 기술은 우리가 연결할 수 있게 해줍니다.

words.example: I can't decide what to eat.

exercises.question: Which modal verb expresses ability in the present?
Which modal verb is used for giving advice?
You ___ wear a seatbelt. (강한 의무)
exercises.explanation: 강한 의무나 규칙을 나타낼 때 'must'를 사용합니다.

exercises.question: What is the past form of 'can'?
___ you help me? (공손한 요청)
exercises.explanation: 공손한 요청을 할 때 'Could', 'Would', 'Can'을 사용할 수 있습니다.

exercises.question: Match the modal with its meaning:
It ___ rain tomorrow. (가능성)
exercises.explanation: 가능성을 나타낼 때 'may', 'might', 'could'를 사용할 수 있습니다.

exercises.question: I ___ to go now. (외부 의무)
exercises.explanation: 외부에서 주어진 의무를 나타낼 때 'have to'를 사용합니다.

exercises.question: Match the word with its meaning:
It is ___ to rain. (~할 것 같은)
What is the opposite of 'likely'?
exercises.explanation: 'Likely(~할 것 같은)'의 반대는 'unlikely(~할 것 같지 않은)'입니다.

exercises.question: Match the modal with its Korean meaning:
___ you like some coffee? (공손한 권유)
exercises.explanation: 'Would you like~?'는 공손하게 권유할 때 사용합니다.

exercises.question: 'I am able to swim' 과 같은 의미는?
___ I use your phone? (정중한 허가 요청)
exercises.explanation: 'May I~?'는 정중하게 허가를 구할 때 사용합니다.

exercises.question: 'You should see a doctor' 는 무엇을 나타내는가?
I ___ swim when I was 5. (과거 능력)
I ___ like a cup of tea, please. (공손한 요청)
exercises.explanation: 'Would like'는 공손하게 원하는 것을 말할 때 사용합니다.

exercises.question: 'You shouldn't eat too much' 의 의미는?
options: 너무 많이 먹지 않는 게 좋다
exercises.answer: 너무 많이 먹지 않는 게 좋다

exercises.question: 'She might be at home' 의 가능성은?
Match the expression with its Korean meaning:
'Must not' 과 'Don't have to' 의 차이는?
exercises.explanation: 'Must not'은 금지, 'Don't have to'는 불필요를 나타냅니다.

exercises.question: She ___ be tired after working all day. (강한 추측)
'I suggest we take a break' 의 의미는?
Match the word with its opposite:
'Do you accept credit cards?' 의 의미는?
'She encouraged me to try' 의 의미는?
Match the word with its meaning:
'It is likely to rain' 의 의미는?
It is ___ to happen. (~할 것 같지 않은)
This technology ___ us to communicate faster. (가능하게 하다)
Match the modal with the sentence:
exercises.explanation: 각 조동사의 용법에 맞는 문장을 연결합니다.

exercises.question: I'm not ___ if he will come. (확실한)
'Perhaps we should leave' 의 의미는?
options: 아마도 우리가 떠나야 할 것 같다
exercises.answer: 아마도 우리가 떠나야 할 것 같다

exercises.question: It will ___ be sunny tomorrow. (높은 확률로 아마도)
I will ___ come to the party. (분명히)
Match the word with its Korean meaning:
'I don't need your help' 의 의미는?
'I prefer tea to coffee' 의 의미는?
exercises.explanation: 'Prefer A to B'는 'B보다 A를 더 좋아하다'입니다.

exercises.question: 'Can I offer you something to drink?' 의 의미는?
Match the expression with its use:
'You are not allowed to enter' 의 의미는?
You need a ___ to park here. (허가증)
You ___ take an umbrella. It may rain. (조언)
___ you pass the salt, please? (공손한 요청)
You can ___ any one you like. (선택하다)
Match the modal with its negation:
It is ___ to bring your ID. (필요한)
Match the word with its opposite:
'He has an obligation to help' 의 의미는?
Match the word with its adjective form:
'She is capable of success' 의 의미는?
Is it ___ to change the date? (가능한)
Match the word with its formality:
Match the word with its meaning:
Match the verb with its pattern:
'Please allow me to speak' 의 의미는?
'He forced me to sign' 의 의미는?
We should ___ young people to learn. (격려하다)
Match the word with its meaning:
'It is likely that' 다음에는?
exercises.explanation: 'It is likely that + 주어 + 동사' 형태입니다.

exercises.question: It is ___ that he will fail. (~할 것 같지 않은)
This program ___ you to create documents. (가능하게 하다)
